intro: Chonemorpha verrucosa, commonly known as the rough chonemorpha, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features fleshy, ribbed stems and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and high temperatures. Chonemorpha verrucosa is often cultivated for its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
